means: 基数（如十进制的10 和二进制的2）
buildings, antennas, spans, earth formations (term used by parachutists) 建筑物
Bank-Americard Service Exchange 美洲银行卡服务兑换手续费
bioarray software environment 生物系列的软件环境
Business Assessment Study and Evaluation 商业估计研究与评价

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"基础"之意。
means: base ： 侧重指构成或支撑某一具体物体的基础，也可指军事基地或用作比喻意义。
basis ： 主要用作抽象或引申意义。
foundation ： 用于具体意义时，侧重指坚固结实的建筑物的基础或地基；用作比喻意义时，与basis基本相同。
ground ： 含义与basis和foundation接近。一般指某种决定、论点或关系的基础，也可指某种原因的基础。

word_mean: 垒
碱
基底：任何东西的最低部分或基础部分
另见basis
基质：化合物的主要部分
碱(旧名盐基)：在化学中，指盐的非酸部分
与酸结合形成盐类的物质
在水溶液中离解放出氢氧离子的物质
其分子或离子能与质子(氢离子)结合的物质
能供给一对电子(对酸)以形成共价键的物质。基托：一种可摘假体，既可支持义齿和支托，又接受基座组织的支持
基本热源, base-load heat source
地基
安装面, 刀柄或刀孔上的一个表面，它平行或垂直于刀具的基面，供刀具在制造、刃磨及测量时作安装或定位用。
底座, 用于支承和连接若干部件的基础零件。
底座, 支架接触底板的承载构件。
底心格, base-centered lattice
基极
管座
基座
基座

sentence.Network_en: The pizza base retains its crispness without becoming brittle.
sentence.Network_cn: 比萨饼的饼底依然酥脆，也没有变得易碎。

sentence.Network_en: Bank base rates of 7 per cent are too high.
The crime was so base that everyone wanted to hush it up.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一罪行如此卑鄙无耻，大家都不想声张出去。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French, from Latin basis 'base, pedestal', from Greek

late Middle English : from Old French bas, from medieval Latin bassus 'short' (found in classical Latin as a cognomen). Early senses included 'low, short' and 'of inferior quality'; from the latter arose a sense 'low in the social scale', and hence (mid 16th cent.) 'reprehensibly cowardly, selfish, or mean'

entry.def: The base of something is its lowest edge or part.

example.ex: There was a cycle path running along this side of the wall, right at its base...
example.tran: 在墙的这边，沿着墙根有一条自行车道。

example.ex: Line the base and sides of a 20cm deep round cake tin with paper.
example.tran: 把一个20厘米深的圆形糕饼盒的底部和四周都垫上纸。

entry.def: The base of something is the lowest part of it, where it is attached to something else.

example.ex: The surgeon placed catheters through the veins and arteries near the base of the head.
example.tran: 外科医生在脑根部的静脉和动脉中放置了导管。

entry.def: The base of an object such as a box or vase is the lower surface of it that touches the surface it rests on.

example.ex: Remove from the heat and plunge the base of the pan into a bowl of very cold water.
example.tran: 先把锅从炉子上拿开，然后把锅底浸入一盆冷水中。

entry.def: The base of an object that has several sections and that rests on a surface is the lower section of it.

example.ex: The mattress is best on a solid bed base...
example.tran: 这种床垫最好放在结实的床板上。

example.ex: The clock stands on an oval marble base, enclosed by a glass dome.
example.tran: 钟放在椭圆形的大理石基座上，外罩玻璃罩。

entry.def: A base is a layer of something which will have another layer added to it.

example.ex: Spoon the mixture on to the biscuit base and cook in a preheated oven...
example.tran: 把混合好的糊糊舀到饼干坯上，然后放入已预热的烤箱烘烤。

example.ex: On many modern wooden boats, epoxy coatings will have been used as a base for varnishing.
example.tran: 很多现代的木船将采用环氧涂层作底漆。

entry.def: A position or thing that is a base for something is one from which that thing can be developed or achieved.

example.ex: The post will give him a powerful political base from which to challenge the Kremlin...
example.tran: 这个职位将给他提供一个强有力的政治基点来挑战克里姆林宫。

example.ex: The family base was crucial to my development.
example.tran: 家庭基础对我的发展至关重要。

entry.def: If you base one thing on another thing, the first thing develops from the second thing.

example.ex: He based his conclusions on the evidence given by the captured prisoners.
example.tran: 他根据被俘囚犯提供的证据得出了这个结论。

entry.tran: （公司的）客户基础，主要（客户）群体
entry.def: A company's client base or customer base is the group of regular clients or customers that the company gets most of its income from.

example.ex: The company has been expanding its customer base using trade magazine advertising.
example.tran: 公司一直通过在商业杂志上刊登广告扩展客户群。

entry.def: A military base is a place which part of the armed forces works from.

example.ex: Gunfire was heard at an army base close to the airport.
example.tran: 机场附近的军事基地传出了炮火声。

example.ex: ...a massive air base in eastern Saudi Arabia.
example.tran: 沙特阿拉伯东部的一个大型空军基地

entry.def: Your base is the main place where you work, stay, or live.

example.ex: For most of the spring and early summer her base was her home in Scotland.
example.tran: 春天和初夏的大部分时间，她都是在苏格兰的家里度过的。

entry.def: If a place is a base for a certain activity, the activity can be carried out at that place or from that place.

example.ex: The two hotel-restaurants are attractive bases from which to explore southeast Tuscany...
example.tran: 对于去托斯卡纳东南部探险的人们来说，这两家酒店是很有吸引力的驻扎地。

example.ex: Los Angeles was still my financial base. I was still doing business there.
example.tran: 洛杉矶仍然是我的财务中心。我还在那里做生意。

entry.tran: 基础成分；主要成分；主料
entry.def: The base of a substance such as paint or food is the main ingredient of it, to which other substances can be added.

example.ex: Drain off any excess marinade and use it as a base for a pouring sauce...
example.tran: 先滗出多余的卤汁，把它当作浇汁的主料。

example.ex: Oils may be mixed with a base oil and massaged into the skin.
example.tran: 将油和基础油混合，按摩直至皮肤吸收。

entry.def: A base is a system of counting and expressing numbers. The decimal system uses base 10, and the binary system uses base 2.
A base in baseball, softball, or rounders is one of the places at each corner of the square on the pitch.
Base behaviour is behaviour that is immoral or dishonest.

example.ex: Love has the power to overcome the baser emotions.
example.tran: 爱能够战胜邪念。

entry.def: If you say that someone is off base, you mean that they are wrong.

example.ex: Am I wrong? Am I way off base? Because I want you to set me straight if you think I'm wrong.
example.tran: 我错了吗？我大错特错了吗？因为如果我不对的话，我希望你能纠正我的错误。

entry.tran: （尤指在近期没有联系的情况下与某人）取得联系
entry.def: If you communicate with someone, especially someone you have not communicated with recently, you can say that you touch base with them.

example.ex: Being there gave me a chance to touch base with three friends whom I had not seen for a year.
example.tran: 在那里，让我有机会和一年没见面的三个朋友取得了联系。

entry.tran: 面面俱到；应付各种情况
entry.def: If someone touches all the bases or covers the bases, they deal with everyone or everything involved in a situation.

example.ex: He has managed to touch all the bases necessary, and trade goes on...
example.tran: 他想方设法把所有必要的事情都处理妥当，生意也维持了下来。

example.ex: The boss covers all bases when he sets up a job.
example.tran: 老板设立一个工作岗位时，需要方方面面都考虑到。

means.word_mean: 1. any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water;

sentences.sentence: "bases include oxides and hydroxides of metals and ammonia"

means.word_mean: 2. installation from which a military force initiates operations;

sentences.sentence: "the attack wiped out our forward bases"

means.word_mean: 3. lowest support of a structure;

sentences.sentence: "it was built on a base of solid rock"
"he stood at the foot of the tower"

means.word_mean: 4. place that runner must touch before scoring;

sentences.sentence: "he scrambled to get back to the bag"

means.word_mean: 5. (numeration system) the positive integer that is equivalent to one in the next higher counting place;

sentences.sentence: "10 is the radix of the decimal system"

means.word_mean: 6. the bottom or lowest part;

sentences.sentence: "the base of the mountain"

means.word_mean: 7. (anatomy) the part of an organ nearest its point of attachment;

sentences.sentence: "the base of the skull"

means.word_mean: 8. a lower limit;

sentences.sentence: "the government established a wage floor"

means.word_mean: 9. the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained;

sentences.sentence: "the whole argument rested on a basis of conjecture"

means.word_mean: 10. a support or foundation;

sentences.sentence: "the base of the lamp"

means.word_mean: 11. the bottom side of a geometric figure from which the altitude can be constructed;

sentences.sentence: "the base of the triangle"

means.word_mean: 12. the most important or necessary part of something;

sentences.sentence: "the basis of this drink is orange juice"

means.word_mean: 13. the place where you are stationed and from which missions start and end
14. (linguistics) the form of a word after all affixes are removed;

sentences.sentence: "thematic vowels are part of the stem"

means.word_mean: 15. the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area;

sentences.sentence: "the industrial base of Japan"

means.word_mean: 16. the principal ingredient of a mixture;

sentences.sentence: "glycerinated gelatin is used as a base for many ointments"
"he told the painter that he wanted a yellow base with just a hint of green"
"everything she cooked seemed to have rice as the base"

means.word_mean: 17. a flat bottom on which something is intended to sit;

sentences.sentence: "a tub should sit on its own base"

means.word_mean: 18. (electronics) the part of a transistor that separates the emitter from the collector
1. use as a basis for; found on;

sentences.sentence: "base a claim on some observation"

means.word_mean: 2. use (purified cocaine) by burning it and inhaling the fumes
3. assign to a station
1. serving as or forming a base;

sentences.sentence: "the painter applied a base coat followed by two finishing coats"

means.word_mean: 2. (used of metals) consisting of or alloyed with inferior metal;

sentences.sentence: "base coins of aluminum"
"a base metal"

means.word_mean: 3. of low birth or station (`base' is archaic in this sense);

sentences.sentence: "baseborn wretches with dirty faces"
"of humble (or lowly) birth"

means.word_mean: 4. not adhering to ethical or moral principles;

sentences.sentence: "base and unpatriotic motives"
"a base, degrading way of life"
"cheating is dishonorable"
"they considered colonialism immoral"
"unethical practices in handling public funds"

means.word_mean: 5. having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality;

sentences.sentence: "that liberal obedience without which your army would be a base rabble"- Edmund Burke
"taking a mean advantage"
"chok'd with ambition of the meaner sort"- Shakespeare
"something essentially vulgar and meanspirited in politics"

means.word_mean: 6. illegitimate
7. debased; not genuine;

sentences.sentence: "an attempt to eliminate the base coinage"

stems_affixes.word_buile: base低下,基础+born出生→adj.出生低微的
debase降低+ed……的→adj.贬低的;品质恶劣的
base低下,基础+ball球→建立基础打球→垒球
base低下,基础+ment具体物→n.地下室
base低下的+ness表名词→n.卑鄙, 下贱
sub下+base低下,基础→地基下的地基

Sentence.sentence: As such, the first writing was based on the way people talk,with short sentences.

Democrats and Republicans can and will take sides on a number of issues, but a more crucial concern is that both are basing major policy decisions on guesstimates rather than looking at the vast wealth of raw data with a critical eye and an open mind.
There is another survey, sometimes referred to as the "payroll survey," that assesses 400000 businesses based on their reported payrolls.

means.word_mean: 基础, 底座

sentences.en: The lamp stands on a circular base.
sentences.cn: 这盏台灯是装在圆形底座上的。

means.word_mean: 基地, 根据地

sentences.en: The country maintains military bases on foreign soil.
sentences.cn: 那个国家在国外设有军事基地。

means.word_mean: 把…建立在, 以…为基础

sentences.en: One should always base one's opinion on facts.
sentences.cn: 我们应总是把自己的观点建立在事实的基础上。

means.word_mean: 基于；以…为根据(on， upon)

sentences.en: He based the book on his own life.
sentences.cn: 他根据他自己的生活写这本书。

means.word_mean: 基于(on, upon)

sentences.en: Fluctuating prices usually base on a fickle public's demand.
sentences.cn: 物价的波动往往因公众需求的变化而造成。

jushi.english: The machine rests on a wide base of steel.
jushi.chinese: 机器安装在一个很大的钢制底座上。

jushi.english: The city will become an important industrial base of our country.
jushi.chinese: 这座城市将成为我国一个重要的工业基地。

jushi.english: A base of agreement was arrived at.
jushi.chinese: 总算达成了协议的基础。
